worklogs.comment:
zhouyuan commented on pull request #5981: ARROW-7336: [C++][Compute] fix minmax kernel options
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5981
 
 
   minmax kernel has MinMaxOptions but not used.
   This patch allows user to make use of this option
   
   Signed-off-by: Yuan Zhou <yuan.zhou@intel.com>

zhouyuan commented on pull request #5981: ARROW-7336: [C++][Compute] fix minmax kernel options
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5981#discussion_r356650047
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/compute/kernels/minmax.cc
 ##########
 @@ -95,8 +95,12 @@ class MinMaxAggregateFunction final
       }
       reader.Next();
     }
-    *state = local;
 
+    if (array.null_count() > 0 && options_.skip_nulls == false) {
+      local.min = static_cast<typename ArrowType::c_type>(NAN);
 
 Review comment:
   hi @bkietz, my intention is to return a null value here, however with different data type different values are returned:
   - with float type, NAN is returned
   - with integer type, 0 is returned   
   this makes the unit tests code inconsistent. Is there a better way to return null here? Thanks!
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #5981: ARROW-7336: [C++][Compute] fix minmax kernel options
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5981#issuecomment-571186712
 
 
   Before going forward, we should answer the question: what should null mean if `skip_nulls` is false? This PR takes the stance that it should mean 0. This sounds a bit arbitrary. The kernel might return null instead. @bkietz 
   
   (also, even with the chosen semantics, the code in the PR is buggy)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

bkietz commented on pull request #5981: ARROW-7336: [C++][Compute] fix minmax kernel options
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5981#discussion_r363363160
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/compute/kernels/minmax.cc
 ##########
 @@ -71,6 +72,7 @@ struct MinMaxState<ArrowType, enable_if_floating_point<ArrowType>> {
 
   c_type min = std::numeric_limits<c_type>::infinity();
   c_type max = -std::numeric_limits<c_type>::infinity();
+  bool has_nulls = false;
 
 Review comment:
   You also need to add logic handling this member to `operator+=` or behavior across multi chunked input will be inconsistent. (for example, `rhs.has_nulls == true` is currently ignored)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
